value:
The Kingdom of Askr is such a
strange place. Nothing like the plains
of my homeland, or even like Caelin.$k$pYet, for some reason... It feels so
familiar.

The people of the plains don't need to
loose countless arrows to hunt. We
need but a single, well-aimed shot.$k$pThis helps ensure our prey does not
suffer needlessly.

Hmm... What can I do to take some of
the burden off you? I know. Maybe a
good sparring session will help.

A spirit of protection resides within
this bow. Reach out your hand... Do
you feel the winds of the plains?

Hii-yaah! O-oh, it's you! I'm so sorry!
Here, let me help you up...$k$pAlthough, you really shouldn't just tap
me on the shoulder like that while I'm
meditating.

I'd be delighted if you could remain
good friends with
$Nf.

Amazing... The spirits must be to
thank for this.

There's a strong tailwind. My
arrows will fly true.

The wind blows against us. But
watch me next time...

I can fight because I have you at
my side.

My name is Lyndis, and I'm here to
help. All threats to this world will be
scattered to the winds.

Eliwood, Hector, and I once fought a
fierce battle—together wiping away a
calamity that threatened the world.$k$pThe Archsage Athos said an evil star
would rise and see the land once
again awash in blood.$k$pI used to await that day in fear,
constantly wondering when it would
finally arrive.$k$pHowever, I'm no longer afraid. If we
saved the world once, we can save it
again.$k$pIt's thanks to the time I've spent with
you that I feel this way.$k$pThe next time I'm all alone on the
plains, or whenever my chest tightens
with worry... Thanks to you, I...$k$pIt's these precious moments with you
that will allow me to carry on. Thank
you, $Nu.
はぁっ！
Wind...
きゃああっ！
I won't lose!
It's time to end this.
I'll hit my mark.
One arrow, one kill.
Aim well and victory is assured.
I let you down...
ふふふ
You're calling me a Legendary Hero? I'm just Lyn. I'm nowhere near that grand.
Look, I'm pretty sure I told you this before—cut it out already.
*deep breathes in and out*
Can you feel it? The same breeze that caresses our skin carries my arrows to their targets.
Once loosed, an arrow will go where I aim it. I've trained long enough—I know.
If I was able to save one world, then surely I can save this one too.
Stick by me. I don't want to lose anyone I care about.
Onward.
What's the plan?
Taking aim!
